etymologies: early 20th century. From adamantine + -oma, probably after German Adamantinom

definitions: Originally: a tumour of odontogenic epithelial cells (adamantoblasts) occurring in the jaws; = ameloblastoma(now rare). In later use: a tumour with a similar histological appearance occurring especially in the tibia.

notes.text: The histogenesis of the adamantinoma of the tibia is unclear. These tumours are generally considered to be benign, but can be locally aggressive or capable of metastasis.
